sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"捆，包"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: pack, package, packet, parcel, bunch, bundle
means: pack ： 指专为背负而包扎的包裹，也指驮物等。
package ： 指包装整齐严密的包裹或一包、一捆、一盒东西。
packet ： 一般指小件行李、邮包、还可指更小一些的包。
parcel ： 着重指邮包，也指将东西扎成小包或不太大的包。
bunch ： 指有规则地把同类东西固定在一起。
bundle ： 指多件东西被捆扎在一起。

sentence.Network_en: Investors can apply for a package of shares at a set price.
sentence.Network_cn: 投资者可以申购固定价格的股票组合。

sentence.Network_en: It is listed among the ingredients on the package.
sentence.Network_cn: 它是包装盒标明的成分之一。

sentence.Network_en: Reports speak of Berlin putting together an aid package for Moscow.
sentence.Network_cn: 报告称柏林正在制订一揽子的莫斯科援助计划。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a noun denoting the action or mode of packing goods): from the verb pack + -age; compare with Anglo-Latin paccagium. The verb dates from the 1920s

entry.def: A package is a small parcel.

example.ex: ...a package addressed to Miss Claire Montgomery.
example.tran: 寄给克莱尔·蒙哥马利小姐的包裹

entry.def: A package is a small container in which a quantity of something is sold. Packages are either small boxes made of thin cardboard, or bags or envelopes made of paper or plastic.

example.ex: It is listed among the ingredients on the package.
example.tran: 它是包装盒标明的成分之一。

entry.def: A package is a set of proposals that are made by a government or organization and which must be accepted or rejected as a group.

example.ex: The government has announced a package of measures to help the British film industry...
example.tran: 政府已经公布了帮助英国电影产业的一揽子措施。

example.ex: They put together a Western economic aid package for Moscow.
example.tran: 他们为莫斯科准备了一整套西方经济援助计划。

entry.def: When a product is packaged, it is put into containers to be sold.

example.ex: The beans are then ground and packaged for sale as ground coffee...
example.tran: 然后那些咖啡豆被磨碎，包装好作为咖啡粉出售。

example.ex: Packaged foods have to show a list of ingredients.
example.tran: 包装食品必须列出食品成分。

entry.tran: （为提高吸引力或趣味性而）包装
entry.def: If something is packaged in a particular way, it is presented or advertised in that way in order to make it seem attractive or interesting.

example.ex: A city has to be packaged properly to be attractive to tourists.
example.tran: 城市必须进行适当的包装以吸引游客。
被包装成知识性节目的娱乐节目

entry.def: A package tour, or in British English a package holiday, is a holiday arranged by a travel company in which your travel and your accommodation are booked for you.

example.ex: If you are on a package holiday, your travel company's rep should act on your behalf.
example.tran: 如果你是参加包价旅游，你的旅行社代表将代为行事。

means.word_mean: 1. a collection of things wrapped or boxed together
3. (computer science) written programs or procedures or rules and associated documentation pertaining to the operation of a computer system and that are stored in read/write memory;

sentences.sentence: "the market for software is expected to expand"

stems_affixes.word_buile: pack包裹;紧的;结合→v.把……打包[或装箱] n.包，捆，包裹
pack包裹;紧的;结合→v.把……打包[或装箱] n.包，捆，包裹

Sentence.sentence: It is part of their health care package.
Mr Jobs, who died recently aged 56, spent his life packaging that magic into elegantly designed, easy-to-use products.
A package deal to be signed in November.
Join a package tour to Mexico
That front-page package you've been working on is nearly complete; one last edit and it's finished.

sentences.en: They package their goods in attractive wrappers.
sentences.cn: 他们把货物包在好看的包装袋里。

sentences.en: Those chocolates have been packaged very attractively.
sentences.cn: 那些巧克力包装得很吸引人。

means.word_mean: 包, 包裹, 包在一起的东西

sentences.en: He brought me a large package.
sentences.cn: 他给我送来一个大包裹。

sentences.en: She sent him a large package of books.
He bought a new software package.
sentences.cn: 他买了一个新的软件包。

means.word_mean: 一整套东西, 一揽子交易

sentences.en: They are trying to put together a package that will end the dispute.
sentences.cn: 他们力图搞一揽子交易结束这场争论。
